dialogue.text: Okay, I won't hide it, he is my best friend after all.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Yes, the tooth fairy came to me yesterday and said that I could become a fairy too!

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Yes, honestly! I know you don't believe in her, but I really saw her! Although it's not exactly “her”...

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Why? You said you didn't believe me.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Because my mom said so, and I don't really believe adults.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Adults like to lie, and I don't like that. And mark my words, I'll never lie.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: I don't know, I believe my parents, they're good people.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: That's why I'm friends with you, because you're a kid too.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: I'm not a kid, I'm going to be the tooth fairy soon! Or the tooth fairy...?

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Yes, of course! Okay, let's go to class.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: We sat through all our classes as usual. During every break, Mike would show his teeth in a funny way, then point at me and wink. When it was all over, I went home.
